title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions of Jones Lang LaSalle Inc

content.text: Jones Lang LaSalle Inc goes public and lists its shares on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the ticker symbol 'JLL'.
Jones Lang LaSalle Inc announces a 2-for-1 stock split, doubling the number of outstanding shares. The split is executed on a specified date, resulting in a halving of the stock price.
Jones Lang LaSalle Inc completes a merger with LaSalle Partners Inc, a real estate investment management firm. The combined company operates under the name Jones Lang LaSalle Inc.
Jones Lang LaSalle Inc announces another 2-for-1 stock split, doubling the number of outstanding shares. This split aims to maintain a reasonable trading price for the stock.
Jones Lang LaSalle Inc initiates quarterly cash dividends to its shareholders, demonstrating its commitment to returning value to investors.

Jones Lang LaSalle Inc announces a 2-for-1 stock split, once again doubling the number of outstanding shares. The split is intended to enhance liquidity and make the stock more accessible to a broader investor base.
Jones Lang LaSalle Inc acquires HFF, Inc, a commercial real estate services firm, expanding its capabilities and strengthening its position in the global market.
Jones Lang LaSalle Inc increases its quarterly cash dividend, reflecting the company's consistent growth and strong financial performance.

news.summary: Europe is lagging behind the U.S. and other Western economies when it comes to economic growth and GDP per capita.

news.headline: MG Properties Acquires Bear Valley Park Apartments in Colorado for $76M
news.summary: MG Properties, a leading real estate investment and management company, has completed the acquisition of Bear Valley Park Apartments, a premier garden-style community located in Denver, Colorado for a total purchase price of $76 million. The closing marks MGP's third multifamily acquisition of 2023 in the Denver area.

news.headline: Construction Industry Rides Wave Of Stable Supply Chains - What This Means For Investors

news.headline: The State of the Top 3 U.S. Life Sciences Hubs
news.summary: The U.S. life sciences real estate market is reassessing the landscape and regaining its footing amid larger questions and concerns about oversaturation and receding growth.  For instance, to end 2021, tenant requirements for space across the top eight life sciences markets in the U.S. stood at over 25 million square feet.  By mid-2023, that number fell to just over 10 million square feet.

news.headline: Cognizant ropes in JLL for sale of its world's largest facility: sources
news.summary: Software services giant Cognizant has appointed real estate management firm JLL as an adviser to find buyers for leasehold land tied to its globally largest facility by area located in Chennai, according to three people familiar with the matter.  The move to exit its Siruseri, Chennai facility comes after Cognizant in May unveiled a restructuring plan to cut costs by $400 million in two years, including giving up 11 million square feet in office space, or around 80,000 seats.  Teaneck, New Jersey-based Cognizant, which has two campuses in the facility owned by the State Industries Promotion Corporation of Tamil Nadu (SIPCOT), holds a long-term lease on the land which it plans to sell, one of the sources added.

news.headline: JLL Broker Joins South Florida Multifamily Team From LA
news.summary: Nick Lavin has joined JLL (JLL)’s South Florida multifamily investment sales team, after spending almost six years in Los Angeles with the brokerage.  Lavin will be working alongside Matthew Lawton, Maurice Habif and Simon Banke.  In June, the powerhouse team, led by Robert Given and Troy Ballard, jumped ship from Cushman and Wakefield to CBRE.
